featured.text: Tom: I was looking for John all afternoon.
At 4:30 in the afternoon, I go off duty. - 3 - 92㈻
Around 1800, the seventh Duchess of Bedford, Anne Maria, began the popular practice of “afternoon tea,” a ceremony taking place at about four o’clock.
I usually eat lunch from twelve to one and generally take a fifteen-minute break in the morning and in the afternoon.

other.text: On a sunny afternoon last month, we all took off our shoes and walked on the grass with _____ feet.
Kevin is , because he broke the living room window this afternoon.
Later in the afternoon, Nelson came to Adam’s office with Peter for their biology project.
The Earl of Sandwich started the afternoon tea ceremony.
Kim was completely ______ after jogging in the hot sun all afternoon; she had little energy left.
It seems not __(21)__ any afternoon in the village, but all of a sudden, people and animals lose consciousness.
According to the passage, which of the following is true? (A) High tea was served later in the day than afternoon tea in the nineteenth century.
Before long, a small meal at the end of the afternoon, involving tea and sandwiches, had become part of the British way of life.

definition.zh_def: 下午，通常指從中午12點到晚上6點之間的時間。
definition.en_def: The period of time from noon to evening, typically considered to be from 12 PM to 6 PM.
definition.example: We will meet in the afternoon to discuss the project.
